meaningMnemonic: The radical <radical>suit</radical> and the kanji <kanji>suit</kanji> are exactly the same! This kanji can also mean <kanji>join</kanji> which makes sense. When something suits you well, like a hat or something, it joins together with you quite well too. Join me, my hat! You suit my head well. It just <kanji>fit</kanji>s, you know?
readingMnemonic:
You need someone who will <kanji>suit</kanji> you. Someone who can <kanji>join</kanji> you on your life journey. So you call Grandpa <reading>ごう</reading>いち.

Note: For the ごう reading mnemonics, we use Grandpa ごういち because こういち is used for the こう reading. So just remember that ごう comes from Koichi's grandpa ごういち.
